result.execSummary:
The defendant Kory Rumsey Forrest was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca(2nd+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Transcript of Sentencing Hearing on Revocation 07/07/2017; Judge Hue presiding.

[MK] case called at 1:22pm. 
Defendant Kory Rumsey Forrest in court, in custody, with Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Sentencing arguments given by counsel.

On Count #1, the Court sentences Mr. Forrest to  3  years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  1  year, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of  2 years.  This sentence is to commence forthwith, concurrent with the present Dodge County case sentence.  

The Court finds that Mr. Forrest is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that Mr. Forrest is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
The Court gives 156 days credit for time already served.

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision the same conditions as were ordered for the Probation term [which are:
--AODA and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent
--any other assesssment, treatment, or counseling per Agent
--random drugs and/ or alcohol screening
--obtain/maintain employment and/or education program per Agent
--no possession of controlled substance without valid prescription
--no contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate per Agent
--to pay the balance due on court financial obligations]
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
recess 1:43pm.
CC: Certified copy to DA on 6/27/17 - hb
Sentencing hearing on revocation on July 7, 2017 at 01:15 pm.

Attorney De La Ros provides information that the defendant will be in the Dodge County Jail till 7/22/17, he anticipates

Sentencing hearing on revocation on June 23, 2017 at 09:30 am.

records.addlTxt:
Cases 15CF81 and 15CT183 called together at 12:51pm [mo]
Defendant Kory Rumsey Forrest in court with Attorney Anthony John Jurek.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " Guilty " entered on Count #1 of Case 15CF81 and Count #1 of Case 15CT183; factual basis stipulated; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court strikes the repeater enhancer of Count #1 of Case 15CF81
The Court does NOT strike the second or subsequent enhancer

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #2 of Case 15CF81 and Count #2 of Case 15CT183

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
Statement made by Mr. Forrest

On Count #1 of Case 15CF81 and Count #1 of Case 15CT183 the adopts the proposed settlement as portrayed in the Criminal Case Settlement


On Count #1 of Case 15CF81 and Count #1 of Case 15CT183 the Court withholds sentence and places the Defendant on Probation for a term of 2 years, with the conditions:
--As to Case 15CT183: To serve  30 days   in the Jefferson County Jail, with Huber/work release privileges, without electronic monitoring; to commence on 2/5/16 at 6:00am
--Days credit for time already served: 0 days
--AODA and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent
--any other assesssment, treatment, or counseling per Agent
--random drugs and/ or alcohol screening
--obtain/maintain employment and/or education program per Agent
--no possession of controlled substance without valid prescription
--no contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate per Agent
--As to Case 15CT183: pay fine of $450 plus costs
--As to Case 15CF81: pay court costs plus $50 drug testing fee

As to Case 15CT183 ONLY (independent of Probation)
--Revocation of drivers license for 16 months
--AODA and follow through with recommended treatment
--Victim impact panel attendance
--Ignition Interlock Device required on any vehicle driven by the Defendant for a 16 month period  
--6 demerit points assessed
recess: 1:30

Cases 15CF81 and 15CT183 called together at 1:10pm [mo]
Defendant Kory Rumsey Forrest in court with Attorney Anthony John Jurek.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Shock verifies victim rights compliance

Atty. Jurek indicates that he has recently been appointed on these cases and leaves scheduling up to the discretion of the Court
ADA Shock requests the Cases be scheduled for PTC and Trial thereafter.

The Court distributes its scheduling order

recess: 1:33pm

NEXT: As to Both Cases: Pretrial Conference on 1/13/16 at 10:00am
           As to Case 15CF81: (1)FSSC on 1/25/16 at 11:00am (2)Jury Trial on 2/4/16 at 8:30am 
           As to Case 15CT183: (1)FSSC on 4/11/16 at 11:00am (2)Jury Trial on 4/14/16 at 8:30am
Court's response to letter from ADA Hall regarding appointment of new counsel. Attorney De La Rosa when can the Court expect counsel to be appointed for Mr. forrest cc: DA & Def.
from State re: State is unable to comply with the Court's order because new counsel has not been appointed

Cases 15CF81 and 15CT183 called together at 3:51pm [mo]
[Scheduled for FSSC today]
Defendant Kory Rumsey Forrest in court with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Atty. Svehlek indicates that Mr. Forrest is requesting SPD appoint successor counsel; requests STC out 30 days to allow appointment of successor counsel.
--ADA Hall indicates that the State is prepared for Trial; does not take position on Defense's request 

Upon inquiry of the Court, Mr. Forrest confirms that he wishes to have Atty. Svehlek withdrawn as counsel from his case(s)

The Court grants Atty. Svehlek's request to withdraw, the Court directs SPD to appoint successor counsel for Mr. Forrest.
The Court orders that the State coordinate with successor counsel and the Court's JA,no later than 11/2/15, to schedule a Status Conference(the STC need not be held prior to 11/2, simply scheduled).
[post-hearing//off-record: Mr. Forrest updates his address to University Ave in Beaver Dam]
recess: 4:04pm 

NEXT: SPD is to appoint successor counsel

[MK] cases #15CF81 and #15CT183 called at 10:07am. 
Defendant Kory Rumsey Forrest appears via videoconferencing from the Dodge County Jail, in custody. His counsel, Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek appears in court.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 
DA Happ verifies victim rights compliance. 
Attorney Svehlek requests that the cases be scheduled for trial.  She intends to have a conference with Mr. Forrest in the near future, and if she finds that the cases should be set for entry of change of plea and sentencing, then she will notify the Court's Judicial Assistant of this. 
recess 10:15am. 


NEXT: (1) FSSC on both cases on August 3rd at 11:00am   (2) Jury Trial on Case #15CF81 on 8/6/15 at 8:30am, and Jury Trial on 8/7/15 at 8:30am (cases are from same dov, but have not been joined)

[MK] cases #15CF81 and #15CT183 called at 9:36am. 
Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek in court.  ADA  Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
In response to the Court's inquiry regarding victim rights compliance, ADA Teuber indicates that these are victim-less offenses.
Attorney Svehlek indicates that she learned this morning that Defendant Kory Forrest is in Dodge County Jail serving a three month term. She requests a status conference in approximately two weeks--by that time, the Defense will know what scheduling they'll be requesting. 
recess 9:38am. 

NEXT:  Status Conference on 6/23/15 at 10:00am.  (arrangements are to be made for Mr. Forrest to appear via videoconferencing from the Dodge County Jail if possible)

Case called at 9:17am [mo]
Defendant Kory R. Forrest in court with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Hall verifies victim rights compliance

Mr. Forrest waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted; ADA Hall gives summary of submitted Information; reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered

The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling
The Court discloses, under SCR 60.04 that in the Court's former capacity as Jefferson County District Attorney, attorneys that DA Wambach supervised/ DA Wambach did prosecute Mr. Forrest. The Court does not feel that any disqualification or recusal is needed.
Attorney Svehlek updates Mr. Forrest's address to Jefferson St. in Waupon.
recess: 9:28am
